title.narrative: Soutien au 13e Congrès mondial sur la santé publique
Support to the 13th World Congress on Public Health

description.narrative:
The Global Health Research Initiative (GHRI) is a partnership of Canadian government agencies, including IDRC that are tackling the complex problems that affect health around the world. GHRI funds innovative global health research and strengthens the ability of low and middle-income countries to carry out and use research as they work to improve the health of their populations. To contribute to meeting these objectives, GHRI provided funding to the 13th World Congress on Public Health in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, in April 2012.
Hosted by the World Federation of Public Health Associations (WFPHA) and the Ethiopian Public Health Association (EPHA), the congress brings together 2,000 public health researchers, academics, scientists, educators, programmers, policymakers, and students from around the world. The 2012 congress aimed to: -serve as an international forum for the exchange of knowledge and experiences on key public health issues; -contribute toward protecting and promoting public health at global, continental, and national levels; -create a better understanding of Africa's major public health challenges within the global public health community; and, -facilitate and support the formation of the African Federation of Public Health Associations.
The theme of the congress is "Towards Global Health Equity: Opportunities and Threats." With the Millennium Development Goals' (MDGs) target year of 2015 fast approaching, congress participants debated and discussed whether health MDGs are being achieved.
GHRI supported its grantees who were presenting at the congress.
